snippet: President Obama and Congressional Republicans on Friday showed greater flexibility but headed into the weekend without a deal to reopen the government and raise the debt ceiling.
abstract: Pres Obama and Congressional Republicans show greater flexibility in their negotiations but head into the weekend without a deal to reopen the government and raise the debt ceiling; senior lawmakers caution against expecting quick deal, even as much of the incendiary speech during fiscal fight gives way to words like 'constructive' and 'progress.'

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS, ASHLEY PARKER and PETER BAKER

lead_paragraph: President Obama and Congressional Republicans on Friday showed greater flexibility but headed into the weekend without a deal to reopen the government and raise the debt ceiling.

headline.main: Divide Narrows as Talks to Resolve Fiscal Crisis Go On
headline.print_headline: Divide Narrows as Talks Go On In Fiscal Crisis

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
